cold_snaps.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no cold snap in progress.  So far, 6 cold snaps have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 3.7.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4-27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwave.status: At present, there is no heatwave.  This year has seen 6 heatwaves; typically, 1.9 heatwaves occur annually.

heaviest_rainfall.status: On 04 January 2025, a record rainfall of 36.8mm was measured, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  4.6mm per hour was recorded as falling at times during the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: A rapid deluge happened today when the rain reached a maximum intensity of 16.6mm per hour (ranked 1st in our records).  The storm lasted 3.2 hours and 5.69mm of precipitation fell during that time.  The most severe rain rate registered stands at 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, highlighting an extreme precipitation event.  21.19mm fell during the storm over 15.0 hours.

storm.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 04 January 2025, it lasted 37.2 hours, delivered 36.8mm of rain at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.
A storm is currently nearby.  It's the first significant stormy weather event since 03 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The ongoing rainy stretch, 10 days and counting so far started on 26 August 2025 and ranks 4th in length since records started in August 2024.  The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

tropical: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current wind direction is southerly (192°), which is about average.  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

run.status: 1754 miles was the largest wind run recorded on 21 October 2012.  The long-term average wind run is 229.41 miles and so far today the wind run is 65.6 miles.

speed.status: 93.7 mph was the largest wind speed recorded on 13 October 2012.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 5.5°C) and outside temperature (down 3.4°C) and drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.5 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in light levels (up 10170 lux), pressure (down 7 mbar), cloud levels (up 201 m), and rainfall (up 0.5 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 13495 lux), cloud levels (up 1669 m), and rainfall (down 0.7 mm) when compared to today.

Yesterday’s cloud levels showed a low of 565m and a peak of 1838m, averaging 909.1m; the week and month recorded warmer averages.

summary.summary: Inside; anticipate mild and comfortable temperatures. Outside; you can expect comfortable, mild temperatures. Also, humidity should not be a concern and calm and still conditions are expected. Light to moderate rain is forecast, partial cloudiness with some periods of sun, and low sunlight due to cloudy or overcast skies. Changeable conditions.
